fields.description:
Have checked in Chrome and Firefox, clicking the add button does nothing.

!589942862-Snip20180705_21.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Can't "add" groups or users to repository, add button does nothing

fields.description:
h2. Summary
A customer cannot view the attachment from the PR's Jira link because it overlaps the first pop up.\\
!816832350-BB_PR_Jira_Screenshot.png|thumbnail!

h2. Expected results
The attachment should pop up in front of the Jira link's pop up.

h2. Actual results
The Jiral link overlaps the attachment pop up.

h2. Workaround
No workaround for now
fields.summary: (UI) Pull request with Jira link overlaps the attachment pop up

fields.description:
Add a comment to any line of code in a pull request.

Use a pipe character in regular text (not in a code snippet).

Save the comment.

Pipe is preceded by a backslash in the resulting comment.

Even upon re-editing the comment, the backslash is retained, and will be re-added.
fields.summary: When commenting with the pipe character ('|'), it gets 'escaped' with a backslash.

fields.description:
When I'm reviewing a non-trivial PR that's composed of many commits it's tedious to have to return to the PR page to get to the next commit. Reloading the PR page can be slow.

It would be very useful to have the commit view page know that it's within the context of a PR and provide links to go to the next/previous commit directly.
fields.summary: When reviewing pull request commits add ability to go directly to the next commit

fields.description: Until ~1st July, we were able to edit the commit message when doing a merge from the web interface. This was an important part of our workflow, as it allowed us to tag when releases were made / related issues etc. And that capability has suddenly vanished. Is that a regression or was it intentional? Can we have the capability back please?
fields.summary: Can no-longer edit commit messages when merging pull requests on mercurial

fields.description: When I open Bitbucket and click the Search button in the top left it would be great if it could search by the Git commit hash as well, across all of the repositories I have access to. Searching by the short version of the hash should work as well.
fields.summary: Allow searching by the Git commit hash

fields.description:
We don't need to perform a git clone of the repo at every single step of our pipeline, files we need between steps can be persisted with {{artifacts}}.

I suggest you move the logic for the following into (b)ash functions:

* git clone (int depth)
* artifact restore (string step_name)

that way users can run the clone or the artifact restore when and how they want.

At the moment it's costing us 55secs for each step, when we only need it on one step per pipeline.
fields.summary: Configure whether step performs git clone

fields.description:
Sometimes we will see with lager repositories that contain sub-folders , when a new Source Browser enabled, loading of the content times out and the server responds with 500 error

The workaround is:\\
go to Bitbucket Labs -> Turn off New Source Browser Beta to use the old UI, then the files load again and content renders

Occasionally it will take a few refresh on the Source view to get the content to render.
fields.summary: With new Source Browser enabled, repository with sub-folders content loading times out (BBCDEV-10385)

fields.description:
I am a developer and I work on many projects. But sometimes I just want to access my personal repositories. Because I spend most of my time working on someone else's repositories, my repositories don't show in "Your work" tab. Bitbucket could add a "My Repos" tab too.

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Add button My Repositories

fields.description: When we are trying to add a new user to the account, the person is not receiving Invitation email. We even tried clicking "Resend Invitation", still no emails received.
fields.summary: New Accounts - Emails not received (JIRA, Stride, BitBucket)
Authentication error when declining PR via API

fields.description:
Getting error *bitbucket.org:443; Connection timed out* while cloning repository from bit-bucket.

git clone https://user@bitbucket.org/abc/abc.git\\
OS:Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server 7.5 (Maipo)
fields.summary: bitbucket.org:443; Connection timed out

fields.description:
When a team member deletes his account, Pull Request which links to the account will auto be updated with the new timestamp.\\
This impacts users who rely on PR's updated date to review codes.

If a repository has a large amount of PR, all the previous pull requests which linked to the account will be updated, and existing users would have to look into in each PR to find the recent created/merged PRs.

h3. Suggestion
* Avoid updating PR's timestamp if a team member delete the account
* Ability to sort Pull-requests based on merged date, etc
fields.summary: Old pull requests' date are updated if a team member delete his account.

fields.description:
A pipelines build quits with "unexpected EOF" with no further information. During a  docker build, while running Python tests the message unexpected EOF displays before the Pipelines build fails. The docker build command is spawned and limited to 2G of memory using the {{-m 2G}} flag in docker. The issue is not reproducible locally in docker at all, so I'm not really sure what to do.

The build is here: https://bitbucket.org/hamweather/data-flow-gdal-worker2/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/93

This seems like maybe expected behavior? Without any message about what happened or documentation, at minimum this should be a task to update docs.

Thanks,\\
-Seth
fields.summary: Pipelines Build: unexpected EOF

fields.description: Blank page displayed.
fields.summary: Activity tab in pull request shows nothing

fields.description:
This is a usability issue so it's important. Not because it stalls the system but because it stalls the user.

I'm having trouble to find out how to do things in Bitbucket so I opened a help page and from there goy into the tutorials page https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/tutorials-755338051.html\\
But this problem might attain all Bitbucket pages.\\
The tutos page has a "Provide feedback about this article" link. I clicked and a form opened so I wrote the text you can find below the "====" and clicked "submit".\\
The form got disabled and it stayed like that fr a long while.\\
The problem is that it didn't say nothing, it gave no feedback, like "thanks, we'll trash your comment soon" or whatever.\\
I don't know if Bitbucket received my comment or not, and meybe will never know.\\
This is the equivalent of telling something to somebody else and getting no acknowledge, just an inexpressive face for as long as you want. Wouldn't it be enraging?\\
Maybe the one who designed this interaction bit knows that the comment is filed and will be reviewed, but I don't. The designer designed for himself.

====\\
I can't find my way inside Bb.\\
I have a working repo and want to add bug tracking, which I was unable to do.\\
Apparently I need to create groups and a team, it isn't clear to me how to do it.\\
I ask myself if it's a feature only available for paid accounts, but it's not said anywhere.\\
I think you have an usability issue here.\\
Bb is facing a massive migeation from GitHub due to its purchase by MS and should hone these issues ASAP in order to capture more customers.\\
You need an usability guy, but not the usual one raised in the graphical design fields (it seems you already have one).\\
You need an UX guy from the engineering side, like most of the Internet usability heroes most of them engineers.\\
As such I struggled with the design-oriented types. They happen to not understand in full the interaction design side. With good interaction you don't need cute design, especially for the nerd customers we are, albeit it's a plus.

Usually the issues like the one I'm having arise from interaction design done by a good engineer that knows a lot about the underlying applications.\\
Such designs give for granted a number of knowledge bits that are obvious for the engineer but not for the newcomers (like me).\\
As nerds we should be able to dive into the engineer's mind (we are like-minded), but I'm failing to do so. Actually, the solution is to have an engineer diving into the user's minds.
fields.summary: "Provide feedback about this article" form froze (somehow)

fields.description: Add Lisp syntax hightlighting to source view
fields.summary: Add Lisp syntax highlighting

Hi,

My two-step verification via my Google Authenticator was not enabled in my BitBucket account? I had to set it up again. How can it disable itself? This is a security worry.

Please advise what could have happened here asap.

Thanks,

Anthony
fields.summary: Two-step verification

fields.description:
Jira issue keys can only contain uppercase letters.\\
The check in Bitbucket for the issue key allows lowercase issue keys but the 'linkification' only works with (valid) uppercase issue keys.

The Jira specification will not be changed, which is why BCLOUD-9615 was closed as Won't Fix.\\
However, the check in Bitbucket should be fixed to reject incorrectly formed issue keys when the require issue keys option is enabled.
fields.summary: Inconsistency in check for required issue keys

fields.description:
It would be nice if there can be a feature to recognize  and parse HTML pages on Bitbucket Static Page without html extension in the URL

*For example*

File name in Bitbucket with HTML Contents : /index.html

* The Static page is not able to parse correctly.\\
https://testpipelinespermission.bitbucket.io/index

File name in Bitbucket with HTML Content : /index.html

* The static page parses the HTML Correctly\\
https://testpipelinespermission.bitbucket.io/index.html
fields.summary: Add feature to recognize  html pages on Static Website without extension

fields.description:
When I go to the branches tab and select "Run pipeline for a branch", I can see my pipelines for branch rules defined in my bitbucket-pipelines.yml, but I am unable to actually trigger one of those pipelines manually. Specifically, when I click "Run" I get a loading icon indefinitely and the pipeline never runs.

I'm not sure if this is a bug or simply a non-existent feature. In either case, I think this function would be useful to have in cases where branch-based rules are added/modified and\\
we want to run the new pipeline for an existing branch.
fields.summary: Manually trigger branch pipelines

fields.description:
We currently have some baseline numbers on what to expect for Git: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bbkb/troubleshooting-network-issues-389778693.html

However, for Git-LFS, it'd be nice to give some examples for customers on what to expect (or what the the minimum threshold should be for Git-LFS speeds). Maybe a small update on our Git-LFS documentation about limitations: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/current-limitations-for-git-lfs-with-bitbucket-828781638.html
fields.summary: Git-LFS throughput documentation

fields.description:
Bitbucket Server already provides [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/pull-request-merge-strategies-844499235.html]:

bq. Rebase, fast-forward (rebase + merge --ff-only): Commits from the source branch onto the target branch, creating a new non-merge commit for each incoming commit. Fast-forwards the target branch with the resulting commits
fields.summary: Option for "rebase + merge --ff-only" merge strategy

fields.description:
At this time, we are unable to do the following as Admins of corp.com to any *@corp.com

# Unable to modify user settings on bitbucket to set a password (not reset) or remove the two factor authentication requirement. We can do that on JIRA but not bitbucket.
# Unable to see, manage private repositories that are created by our employees

We need to be able to "Log in as User" and then take full control over their account without needing to know their login info, only their user name. We had one member that lost their two factor authentication for bitbucket including the recover codes, then no one was able to help him... bitbucket support had to delete his entire account.
fields.summary: Corporations need complete control over accounts with their domain

The diff fails on page load, and every diff after this also fails.

'Click here to give it another chance.' fails for the files with the plus signs, subsequent files that do not contain this character succeed

fields.description:
Find it a bit time consuming to select the file path as it requires careful pointing to select without whitespaces.

Could you allow when I click icon it copies the file path to clipboard? or when I double click the name it should only select the file path.

At the moment double click selects file path + [MODIFIED].

This helps when we try to open  file on editor and speed up workflow.

fields.description:
I have a build BCLOUD-10 deployed to production but need to quickly rollback to build BCLOUD-9 (the previous stable deployment). If I select the build BCLOUD-9 and click re-run it generates a build BCLOUD-11 which goes through test, staging, etc. This is problematic because the build artifacts are associated with build BCLOUD-9 and are actually readily stored & available in S3 in our case. A build BCLOUD-11 would a) take time and b) recreate the artifacts from scratch, thus, it would not be really a rollback.

Given how BB Deployments is built on top of BB Pipelines, I guess what would be needed is to be able to re-run a specific step.

(raised with @aneita via email)
fields.summary: Permit Rollbacks in Bitbucket Cloud Deployments

fields.description:
We sent an invitation to a user that didn't exist. After that point he tried to register an account with bitbucket but was told the account already existed with Atlassian. However, the reset password link said it was successful but did not send an email. Subsequent attempts to resend the original invitation and password resets were also not received.

We are willing to delete the account and start over (not the organization, the user). We just want the bitbucket and atlassian accounts to be "linked" and allow the employee to log in and do work. :)
fields.summary: User invitation to team never arrives
Provide clearer steps on the "Get your local Git repository on Bitbucket" section on a new repository source page.

fields.description:
Hi,

I recently needed to run two builds (production and stable development images) in parallel and I found that parallel steps d not support the {{trigger: manual}} property.

We run out test scripts before the builds and need a manual trigger since not every pipeline trigger should build a new image. As a workaround I created a "dummy step" before the parallel build steps just to enable the manual trigger, but this creates an overhead because nothing is done inside this "dummy step".

Could you enable the {{trigger: manual}} property inside parallel steps so it's faster? Also it's more declarative and makes the yaml clearer to read. The syntax could be something like this:

{code}
#!yaml

parallel:
    trigger: manual
    - step:
        script: ...
    -step:
        script: ...

{code}

Thank you!
fields.summary: Manual trigger for parallel group

fields.description:
We build our container on {{php:7.2}} base image. That means that every time a patch version is released, the base image is changed. That happens quote often. We're using docker cache for our build.

That works great. First build takes a longer time as it compile PHP extensions, etc. Subsequent builds are using the cached layers to speed up the process.

But when a new patch version of the base image is released, the base image changes. Therefore build pulls whole new image and all the previously cached layers are invalid. It builds the image from scratch and then when build succeeds it *does not proceed to upload the cache* with following message.

{code}
**Cache "docker": Skipping upload for existing cache**
Searching for test report files in directories named [test-results, failsafe-reports, test-reports, surefire-reports] down to a depth of 4
Finished scanning for test reports. Found 0 test report files.
Merged test suites, total number tests is 0, with 0 failures and 0 errors.
{code}

Currently the only workaround I know is to delete the cache every time new patch version of the base image is released.
fields.summary: Force cache upload if it changed

fields.description:
While developing highly [requested feature|https://stiltsoft.customercase.com/forums/awesome-graphs-for-bitbucket/ideas/7051-contributors-graphs-for-analyzing-contributions-made-by-each-contributor-or-by-everyone-in-the-team] of [Awesome Graphs for Bitbucket Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213426/awesome-graphs-for-bitbucket-cloud%3Fhosting%3Dcloud%26tab%3Doverview] we noticed that REST [{{/2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/diffstat/{spec}}}|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/diffstat/%257Bspec%257D] always returns http 500 for the first commit of any hg repo with the following JSON body:

{code}
{"type": "error", "error": {"message": "Something went wrong", "id": "f08d610fa13b49bdbdead955aa24c436"}}
{code}

Here is the list of public repositories with links to commits and API requests for you to reproduce this issue:

h3. Repo 1  https://bitbucket.org/dayturn/dayturn
the first commit UI link: https://bitbucket.org/dayturn/dayturn/commits/003dd9461bfa479049afcc34545ab3431b147c7c

the first commit diffstat API req: https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/%7B%7D%2F%7Bdaafc28d-027e-49a1-8f51-a6fbc5d243f5%7D/diffstat/003dd9461bfa479049afcc34545ab3431b147c7c

h3. Repo 2 https://bitbucket.org/dzagorovsky/pypy-fork
the first commit UI link: https://bitbucket.org/dzagorovsky/pypy-fork/commits/45eff22199974f85fd96138d25510f4660aba5a1

the first commit diffstat API req: https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/%7B%7D%2F%7B162486ca-97f7-4ba6-96f6-e11fd145a9bd%7D/diffstat/45eff22199974f85fd96138d25510f4660aba5a1

Also the same error returns for a commit in the middle of pypy repo:\\
Commit UI link: https://bitbucket.org/dzagorovsky/pypy-fork/commits/bf2c629d00711b091509f687151a057cf3098b13

Commit diffstat link: https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/%7B%7D%2F%7B162486ca-97f7-4ba6-96f6-e11fd145a9bd%7D/diffstat/bf2c629d00711b091509f687151a057cf3098b13

We have tested API 2.0 commit diff stat with a bunch of our private and public hg repositories. The first hg repo commit diffstat always returns http 500.
fields.summary: API 2.0 commit diffstat always returns http 500 for the first commit of any hg repo

fields.description:
Whenever I create a new pull request, a list of recent reviewers is presented as a suggestion. Somehow I managed to have myself included in this list.

fields.description:
h2. UPDATE 12-12-2018##
This issue appear to be related to the portal translation engine for non-english users with non-english language set in user preferences.

Possible fix:

* set user profile language to EN
* clear browser cache
* set user profile language to the favorite one.

h2. ORIGINAL
In the src view, the file README.md is not rendered (or at least it get rendered once in a (long long) while). Instead of a formatted text, the markdown plain text is shown.

Browser: Chrome 67.0.3396.99 and firefox 60.0.2

Expected view: !752287981-render.PNG|thumbnail!

Displayed view: !1825214559-no_render.PNG|thumbnail!

The same markdown is correctly formatted in the preview page of the online editor
fields.summary: Markdown README.md not rendering in src view ( localization related issue on non-english user profiles)

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
Bitbucket supports IPv6 for HTTPS connection but not for SSH connection:

{code}
$ ssh -6T git@bitbucket.org
ssh: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Network is down
{code}

h2. Suggested Solution
Support IPv6 for SSH connection as well.

h2. Workaround
Edit SSHD configuration file (such as ~/.ssh/config) to enforce IPv4 connection:

{code}
Host bitbucket.org
  AddressFamily inet
{code}
fields.summary: Support IPv6 for SSH connection

fields.description:

Slack "pipelines fixed" notification is not working on Bitbucket cloud.

h3. *Steps to reproduce*
# Create a repository (with Pipelines enabled)
# Create Slack account
# Connect repository to Slack account via repository > settings > Chat nofications settings
# Add "pipelines fixed" notification to "Repository-wide" branch settings
# Push a commit to the repository then go to pipelines (make the commit to be failed)

!2227043158-slack_pipelines_fixed.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Expected results*
Slack "pipelines fixed" notification should fire when Pipelines' build.\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/notifications-for-bitbucket-pipelines-857053284.html

h3. *Actual results*
Slack "pipelines fixed" notification is not firing
fields.summary: Chat Slack pipeline fixed notification is not working (BCI-275)

fields.description:
Attached to this issue is a {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}} for reference.

As you can see, we use the env vars {{PROD_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID}} and {{PROD_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_SECRET}}, to deploy master branch to our production instance.

However, any developer can change the {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}} and use those env vars for the 'default' pipeline and *thus deploy dev code or any other malicious code to the production environment*. In fact, this can even happen by accident by a developer editing the file and copy/pasting portions of it to a different step.

There is no way to limit the visibility of these env vars defined in bitbucket project to ensure they are only available while running the master branch pipeline.

This seems to be a huge security issue, allowing any developer to modify the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file and deploy absolutely anything to the production environment.
fields.summary: Huge Security Issue with Environment Variables

fields.description:
Whether created from JIRA integration or BB Branches View, changing "Branch From" takes a couple seconds for each iteration through the select list.

In addition to feature branches, we have a master branch and a development branch. Feature branches should Branch From the development branch. The default is master. So, we have to switch to development. This takes about 30 seconds just to filter and select the development branch - typically is very frustrating since each mousemove or typing filter value takes seconds to process (see console output below).

We have a lot of Tags in that list too.

Browser: Chrome, Version 58.0.3029.110 (64-bit), no adblocker running.

selecting

{code}
(index):35 [Violation] 'mouseover' handler took 273ms
11:23:10.318 [Violation] Forced reflow while executing JavaScript took 271ms
11:23:10.628 (index):35 [Violation] 'mouseout' handler took 304ms
11:23:10.628 [Violation] Forced reflow while executing JavaScript took 304ms
11:23:22.511 (index):35 [Violation] 'mousemove' handler took 2570ms
11:23:29.928 (index):35 [Violation] 'mousemove' handler took 1985ms
{code}

filtering

{code}
[Violation] 'input' handler took 3711ms
11:30:30.040 bitbucket.org/:35 [Violation] 'input' handler took 224ms
11:30:30.212 [Violation] Forced reflow while executing JavaScript took 516ms
11:30:33.319 bitbucket.org/:35 [Violation] 'input' handler took 2308ms
11:30:33.541 [Violation] Forced reflow while executing JavaScript took 524ms
11:30:38.046 bitbucket.org/:35 [Violation] 'mouseup' handler took 205ms
{code}

A performance trace shows "nrWrapper" and sentry.js as the long running functions.
fields.summary: Create Branch is Slow to Load Source Branches

fields.description:
E.g. https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/issues#post

There are no "version", "assignee", "milestone", "version" fields' names displayed. We can only infer names from descriptions in "type" section (screenshot is attached).

It seems that schema parser is broken or configured improperly. Manually parsing schema JSON gave me correct results.
fields.summary: API docs missing field names

fields.description:
h2. *Summary*
Pull request is not updated when gets approved by the reviewer.\\
Also, when the pull request is set to unapproved by the reviewer, the receiving end receives a notification that the Pull request is approved. (See screenshot)

!2296454261-Pull_request_Bug_6252018_001.png|thumbnail!

h2. *Steps to reproduce*
# User A raises PR, keeps PR page open in browser.
# User B (reviewer) opens PR, reviews.
# User A sees User B's avatar on the bottom right of the PR page indicating User B is viewing the PR.
# User B(reviewer) clicks Approve on the PR.
# User A wait several minutes but the PR page never updates to show User B's approval.
# User A opens the same PR page in another browser window, User B''s approval is shown there.
# User A closes new browser window, returns to original PR window, approval still not shown.
# User B clicks Unapprove on the same PR. (*Where the bug came in*)
# Within 20 seconds User A sees User B's "viewing" avatar at the bottom right showing the Green Tick overlay. Mousing over User B's overlay reports "User B has approved this PR". However at this point, the PR is actually not approved.

h2. *Expected results*
* User A's PR will be updated asynchronously (or real-time)
* User A should not received a notification of approved PR while the action is "unapproved"

h2. *Actual results*
* User A's PR is not updated asynchronously (or real-time)
* User A receives a notifcation of approved PR when "unapproved" action is done by User B(reviewer)

h2. *Workaround*
Reload the page every time we will check any approvals
fields.summary: Pull request UI is not updated (real-time or asynchronously) while approving by the reviewer

fields.description:
After pushing my initial commit to a new origin repo on bitbucket, the homedirectory shows all the files but when I try to open the only folder in the directory I get the following error:

Normally, you'd see the directory here but something didn't go right.

Try again

There should be files in the folder.
fields.summary: "Having trouble showing that directory" error

fields.description:
Bitbucket Cloud shows the following error in the browser console instead of showing on the Bitbucket UI.

* SSH key is invalid
* Someone has already added that SSH key to another account.
* Someone has already added that access key to this repository

Hence, the "Loading" icon keeps spinning and users would need to open Browser console to identify what caused the issue.

Images:\\
!4291028428-SSH%20key%20error.gif|thumbnail!

!2985736513-SSH-key%20another%20account.PNG|thumbnail!\\
!1837594444-SSH-key%20another%20access%20key.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: UI not showing any error when SSH key added to Bitbucket (BBCS-40)

fields.description:
Currently, you have to copy the Dockerfile inside your build context folder in order to build - "docker build -f FILE_NAME".

Calling a file not in the folder will give you an error:\\
The Dockerfile (Dockerfile) must be within the build context (/full/path/to/directory/containing/the/given/dockerfile/)

This is fixed in Docker 18.03.1-ce, but Pipelines is currently using an earlier version.
fields.summary: Upgrade Docker Daemon to 18.03.1-ce or later

fields.description:
Hi,

Are there plans to add a path trigger (or something similar) to pipelines ? It may come in handy for some use cases. Here is one :

We are working on a new serverless environment and we have a lot of seperate bits of code that get tossed to the cloud to do their work. For the moment, we cannot use bitbucket pipelines to automate deployments since the existing triggers are not working for us.\\
All these functions are grouped in the same repo(s) :

* It is not practical to have a repository per function since it will be a hell to set up for new recruits
* Nor is it practical to have a branch per function since a feature may affect more than one function at once.
* Tags don't work either since there is no way to filter what needs to be deployed and what stays still
* Custom triggers may work but it is not much different than manual commands we use right now to deploy

Since functions count in our projects grows constantly, it would be nicer if deployments are handled automatically.

Also, combining path and branch triggers would be ideal for deploying into multiple environments.

Are there plans for an additional trigger that does the job or something similar to help with serverless development ?
fields.summary: A new trigger for pipelines

fields.description:
So I posted this on the Community Discussion site, but it's worth having here.

We need to restrict our pipeline steps to only run when commits contain changes in our {{client/**/*}} filepath glob.

Concourse.ci, Drone.ci, and I assume other CI servers provide the option to restrict steps to commits only containing certain file paths.

At the moment it seems we are limited to manually grepping "git log" and emitting an {{exit 1}}, which would cause the build to fail.

Ideally I'd want a branch build to not even start, so being able to specify branches and steps to only run when there are (or are not) matching files in the commit would look like:

{code:yml}

- step:
  image: node:alpine-8
  script:
    - npm install
    - npm run prod
  filter:
    includes:
      - client/src/**/*
      - package.json
   
...
{code}

So that commits containing file changes matching:

* {{server/**/*}} and {{client/**/*}} would run the above step
* {{server/**/*}} would not run the above step
* {{client/**/*}} would run the above step
* {{package.json}} would run the above step

Other examples:

{code}
- step:
  filter:
    excludes:
      - server/**/*.cshtml
{code}

{code}
- step:
  filter:
    includes:
      - client/build/gulp/**/*
    excludes:
      - server/**/*.cshtml
{code}

excludes would prevent the step from running if any files in the commit match the patterns.

includes would ensure that the step only ran if at least one of the changed files matches the patterns.
fields.summary: Trigger pipeline only if certain files are changed
New repository request to use git remote set-url instead of git remote add

fields.description:

I have a monorepo for my microservice app with multiple small services.\\

fields.description:
On the Pipelines dashboard, when a manual pipeline is run, it would be great to show the name of that custom pipeline that was run, in lieu of where you put the branch name for a automatic pipeline build.

Attachment shows 2 builds on the dashboard -- one on develop that is labelled, and one that was manual, with no indication that it was manual, or which manual build it was.
fields.summary: Show custom manual pipeline name

fields.description:
According to the documentation (https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/) there are no endpoints for listing or modifying groups, group members and group repository permissions.

There was group support in v1 but this version is going to be deprecated soon\\
(https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/groups-endpoint-296093143.html and\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/group-privileges-endpoint-296093137.html)
fields.summary: No API support for groups in v2

fields.description:
The F# language lets you treat any operator as a function by enclosing it in parentheses; this allows you to add the items of a list by using {{List.reduce (+)}}. (Of course, {{List.sum}} already exists for this purpose). However, when that operator is the multiplication operator {{*}}, the syntax highlighting in the source browser mistakes the {{(*}} sequence for the opening of a multi-line comment (which in F# is enclosed between {{(*}} and {{*)}} and can be nested). There's a special rule in the F# parser that says that the sequence {{(*)}} is not a comment-opener followed by a right parenthesis, but is instead the multiplication operator between parentheses.

To demonstrate of the issue, here are two lines of code that multiply all the items of a list together and print its output.

{code:fsharp}
let product lst = lst |> List.reduce (*)
printfn "%d" (product [1; 2; 3; 4; 5])  // Prints 120
{code}

When I preview this code in the issue tracker, the syntax highlighting in the issue tracker gets it right: the second line is not highlighted as a comment. But if you [look at the same source code in a file in the source browser|https://bitbucket.org/rmunn/repro-syntax-highlighting/src/master/repro.fsx], the highlighting is wrong, and it shows the second line as a comment.

Screenshot showing correct highlighting in issue tracker:

!2492034545-correct.png|thumbnail!

Screenshot showing incorrect highlighting in source browser:

!2101611419-incorrect.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Incorrect syntax highlighting for F# code

We are facing intermittent issues with one REPO from few days .Developers are doing changes but those are getting reverted .We are not able to figure it out whether some one has used push force command for the same or size of repo is causing issues .

Is there any way we can enable the command history enabled so we can track which command is causing issue .

Kindly suggest the options to explore which can be helpful.
fields.summary: Command history needs to be enabled in commit page

fields.description:
Right now, when a user has a child fork that is under the umbrella of the parent's privacy setting "Only allow private forks", we will simply not save the settings at all.

Let's make a clear error that we're unable to change the fork's settings (private to public) based on the parent's settings.
fields.summary: Warn users of setting privacy settings of a restricted fork

fields.summary: gay pride flag / (Rainbow flag (LGBT movement)) is displayed after 'git push'

fields.description:
Dear,

Since this morning, the pipeline UI doesn't appear from web browser.

I tried to reload and refresh my web browser cache but still not working.

OS: Mac OS Sierra

Web browser: Goole Chrome 67.0.3396.87
fields.summary: Pipeline UI KO
'next' key in API response does not respect reverse sorting by updated_on

fields.description: Nothing happens clicking the add user button in Firefox.
fields.summary: The add user button to repository does not work
